object.content:
The color indigo - meaning and effect

Indigo color meanings

The color indigo is characterized by very high frequency vibration and with purple and gold, is considered to be a color that expresses spirituality, elevation and intense search of absolute truth.

Indigo is a dark blue which is a combination between intuition and spirituality superior, allowing direct access to wisdom. This color refers to compassion and superior state of serenity and inner peace. Indigo gives a sense of human beings and especially hiperluciditate sense of responsibility, which involves specifying with great clarity, lucidity and discernment of course goals and their achievement need.

Indigo exert a beneficial influence on the effects purification generating body, calming and sedation.

Therapeutic effects of indigo color

The color blue has a wide range of therapeutic applications, as astringent and anesthetic. This color stimulates thyroid activity considerably.

The color indigo is indicated in cases of obesity, migraines, sinusitis, vajaituri ears, decrease or loss of taste or smell sensation. In addition, indigo color, favoring the achievement of good internalization, help accelerate the achievement of meditation and spiritual evolution. Indigo color acts as a purifier of the circulatory system. Also, the color indigo is a great liberating factor and a great mental refinement that allows control and subtle deep psychological level.

Intense blue color of indigo combines admirable devotion and clear thinking, lucid, with the highest aspects of a stabilizer shades of red. Precisely because of this, indigo color, combines great power with immediate effective.

The assimilation of this color in large amounts lightning are possible beneficial changes at all levels of being. Indigo color vision enables spiritual awakening and amplification. From a spiritual color indigo is considered the reflection of the Holy Spirit.


Physiological effects of indigo color: deep sleep, hibernation, reduced metabolic activity.

The psychological effects of color indigo: retention, transcendence, introversion (interiorization) copies, emotion, feeling great deep, ecstatic fullness, fast thinking, merger and unbounded, atotputere, maximum creativity.

Therapeutic indications of the color indigo:

- Sexual abuse / nymphomania / erotic obsessions,
- Diseases of the nose and ears,
- Asthma,
- Lung disease,
- Bronchitis,
- Cataract,
- Infant seizures,
- Delirium tremens,
- Senile dementia,
- Serious mental imbalances,
- Delusions / deception,
- Exorcisms,
- Granulozitatila eyelids,
- Hallucinations,
- Inflammation of the eyes and ears,
- Hypochondria,
- Hysteria,
- Chronic melancholy,
- Migraine,
- Obesity,
- Obsessions,
- Otalgia (ear pain),
- Facial paralysis,
- Loss of sense of smell,
- Pneumonia,
- Rheumatism,
- Leakage of blood from the nose (bleeding),
- Sinusitis,
- Deafness,
- Disorders of the eye,
- Mental disorders (when the subject is violent and hyperexcitable)
- Irritating cough dry,
- Chronic ulcers of the cornea,
- Vajaituri ears.
